item.title: Bash Aliases
item.author: mail@eucalypto.net (Viktor Papara)
item.description: Aliases for command line in .bashrc In ubuntu the .bashrc file has a command that looks for ~/.bash_aliases and includes it. Here you find my .bash_aliases file with useful aliases. This is the code in the .bashrc file: # Alias definitions. # You may want to put all your additions into a separate file like # ~/.bash_aliases, instead of adding them here directly. # See /usr/share/doc/bash-doc/examples in the bash-doc package. if [ -f ~/.
